SEARCH

Class Solver

java.lang.Object
Solver
public class Solver extends Object
Solver class provides different algorithms to solve a maze: - BFS (Breadth-First Search) - DFS (Depth-First Search) - A* algorithm - Dijkstra algorithm - Wall follower (left and right) It also tracks the time taken for each solving attempt.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Description
    Solver()
    Default constructor initializes timer variables.

  • Method Details

    • bfs

      public boolean bfs(Maze maze)
      Solve the maze using Breadth-First Search (BFS). Marks visited nodes and the final path with "V" and "B" respectively.
      Parameters:
      maze - maze to solve
      Returns:
      true if path found, false otherwise

    • dfs

      public boolean dfs(Maze maze)
      Solve the maze using Depth-First Search (DFS). Marks visited nodes and the final path with "V" and "D" respectively.
      Parameters:
      maze - maze to solve
      Returns:
      true if path found, false otherwise

    • aStar

      public boolean aStar(Maze maze)
      Solve the maze using A* algorithm. Combines BFS with heuristic (Manhattan distance). Marks visited nodes and final path with "V" and "A" respectively.
      Parameters:
      maze - maze to solve
      Returns:
      true if path found, false otherwise

    • dijkstra

      public boolean dijkstra(Maze maze)
      Solve the maze using Dijkstraâ€™s algorithm. Marks visited nodes and final path with "V" and "K" respectively.
      Parameters:
      maze - maze to solve
      Returns:
      true if path found, false otherwise

    • wallFollowerLeft

      public boolean wallFollowerLeft(Maze maze)
      Solve the maze with wall follower algorithm (left-hand rule). Marks path with "L" and visited nodes with "V".
      Parameters:
      maze - maze to solve
      Returns:
      true if path found, false otherwise

    • wallFollowerRight

      public boolean wallFollowerRight(Maze maze)
      Solve the maze with wall follower algorithm (right-hand rule). Marks path with "R" and visited nodes with "V".
      Parameters:
      maze - maze to solve
      Returns:
      true if path found, false otherwise

    • get_time_ms

      public long get_time_ms()
      Returns the duration of last solve in milliseconds.
